Page.Name: KikoDsmUnpackHelp_NoRouter
Page.Text: An internet router is only required to make use of the full range of network features (like playing stored digital music, internet radio, etc) the Kiko DSM has to offer.\n\nYou can still connect other equipment (games consoles, set top boxes, Blu-ray players, etc) to your Kiko DSM and listen to them without an internet router.

Page.Name: KikoDsmUnpackHelp_Missing
Page.Text: Sorry for the inconvenience. You will need to contact Linn to arrange a replacement.

Page.Name: KikoDsmUnpackHelp_Feet
Page.Text:
The Kiko DSM has been designed to work horizontally or vertically. The display will even change based on the orientation you choose.

If you go for horizontal, you need to fit the feet to the bottom of the Kiko DSM to make sure it doesn't wobble.

If you go for vertical, you don't need the feet.

Page.Name: KikoDsmUnpackHelp_Batteries
Page.Text:
Removing the battery cover can be tricky. Try using a coin in the small insert at the top of the cover to help pop it off.

To remove (or replace) a battery, push down on it and slide it gently towards the right corner (marked with a small '+' on the remote). The battery should pop out on its own.
[HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpRemoteBatteries.png]
Batteries must be inserted into the remote plus (+) side up.

Page.Text: CONNECT
Connect the blue and red end of each speaker cable to your speakers.
Push
Turn Clockwise and Click

Page.Name: KikoDsm_Connect2
Page.Text: CONNECT
Connect the blue and black end of each speaker cable to the correct left or right speaker output on your Kiko DSM.
Push
Turn Clockwise and Click

Page.Text: CONNECT

Page.Name: KikoDsm_Connect4
Page.Text: CONNECT
Switch your Kiko DSM on.
Turning On: A flashing dot should appear on the front display for up to 30 seconds, followed by the Linn logo.

I want to use different speakers

Page.Name: KikoDsmConnectHelp_SpeakerConnect
Page.Text:
Here are the steps you should follow to connect your speaker cables:

[ul][li]Line the cable connector up with the corresponding slot (like a key)[/li][li]Push the connector down until it is flush with the slot[/li][li]Rotate the connector clockwise[/li][li]You will hear a 'click' noise once the connector is fitted correctly[/li][/ul]
Note: the grey and blue connector should be connected to the Kiko DSM, and the red and blue connector should be connected to the speaker.

Page.Name: KikoDsmConnectHelp_DifferentSpeakers
Page.Text: You must connect the supplied Kiko speakers to your Kiko DSM.

Page.Name: KikoDsmConnectHelp_NoDotFlashing
Page.Text: This suggests that the Kiko DSM is not powering up.\n\n[ul][li]Check the power cable is connected securely[/li][li]Check that your mains outlet is active/switched on[/li][li]Check the power switch is set to ON[/li]

Page.Name: KikoDsmConnectHelp_DotFlashingForever
Page.Text:
This suggests that your Kiko DSM is attempting to connect to your home network.

At this stage, you should insure that the ethernet cable is NOT plugged in to the back of your Kiko DSM.
[HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpNoEthernetCable.png]

Page.Name: KikoDsm_Audio1
Page.Text: AUDIO

Press and hold the # key on your remote for 3 seconds. The display should change from the Linn logo to a playlist icon as shown and audio should begin playing. You should hear both speakers together, followed by left then right separately.
Press and hold # to begin the audio check

Default.Control: I don't see a Linn Logo

Page.Name: KikoDsmAudioHelp_NoLogo
Page.Text:
Your Kiko DSM must be in standby, indicated by the Linn logo, before you can proceed with the audio check.

Press the standby button on the remote. You should now see a Linn logo (as shown).
[HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpStandbyButton.png][HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/KikoDsm/HelpLinnLogo.png]
If not, you will need to go back through the connection section and make sure everything is correctly connected and powered on.

Page.Name: KikoDsmAudioHelp_NoDisplayChange
Page.Text:
Make sure you hold the # key down on the remote for at least 3 seconds.

If the display still does not change, you will need to make sure the remote is working correctly:

[ul][li]Press any button on the remote. You should see a red light come on behind the standby button.[/li][HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpRemoteLit.png][li]If the red light does not come on, you will need to check the remote batteries.[/li][li]Remember the remote batteries need to be inserted plus (+) side up.[/li][/ul]

Page.Name: KikoDsmAudioHelp_NoDisplayX
Page.Text: The audio check will not run if your ethernet cable is connected. Please disconnect the ethernet cable and power cycle your device.\n[HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpNoEthernetCable.png]

Page.Name: KikoDsmAudioHelp_Silence
Page.Text:
Try increasing the volume by pressing the Volume + button on the remote.[HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpVolumeButtons.png]
If this doesn't work, try the audio check again:

[ul][li]Put the device into standby using the standby button on the remote[/li][li]The Linn logo should now be shown on the dispaly. The audio check will not run if the device is not in standby.[/li][li]Trigger the audio check by pressing and holding the # key on the remote for at least 3 seconds[/li][li]Check that the display changes to show the playlist icon[/li][li]The display should also show a small 'x' in the bottom right corner.[/li][li]Try increasing the volume again[/li][/ul]

Page.Name: KikoDsmNetworkHelp_NoRouter
Page.Text:
An internet router is only required to make use of the full range of network features (like playing stored digital music, internet radio, etc) the Kiko DSM has to offer.

You can still connect other equipment (games consoles, set top boxes, Blu-ray players, etc) to your Kiko DSM and listen to them without an internet router.

If you don't want to use your Kiko DSM on the network, then you are done!

Page.Name: KikoDsmNetworkHelp_NoSocket
Page.Text:
You will need to use a network switch as well.

[ul][li]Connect your Kiko DSM to a network switch[/li][li]Connect another device that is currently connected to your internet router to the network switch[/li][li]Connect your network switch to your internet router.[/li][/ul]
You can have a look at our {http://docs.linn.co.uk/wiki/index.php/DS_Budget_System, network setup guide} for more information.

Page.Name: KikoDsmNetworkHelp_NoDotFlashing
Page.Text: This suggests that the Kiko DSM is not powering up.\n\n[ul][li]Check the power cable is connected securely[/li][li]Check that your mains outlet is active/switched on[/li][li]Check the power switch is set to ON[/li][/ul]

Page.Name: KikoDsmNetworkHelp_DotFlashingForever
Page.Text:
Your Kiko DSM is having trouble connecting to your internet router.
[HelpImageRight,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpEthernetLights.png]
Check the lights on the ethernet socket of your Kiko DSM. The yellow/orange light should be solid and the green light should be blinking.

If not, you are not connected to your router.

[ul][li]Make sure the ethernet cable is connected to your Kiko DSM and to your router[/li][li]Make sure your internet router is switched on[/li][li]If you are using a network switch, make sure it is switched on as well[/li][/ul]
If the lights on the ethernet socket of your Kiko DSM are on, your router is most likely configured incorrectly:

[ul][li]Your router must have DHCP enabled. This is the only way your Kiko DSM can join the network. This is the default configuration for most routers.[/li][/ul]
You can have a look at our {http://docs.linn.co.uk/wiki/index.php/DS_Budget_System, network setup guide} for more information.

Page.Name: KikoDsmNetworkHelp_NoDevice
Page.Text:
There is a problem finding your Kiko DSM on the network.[HelpImageRight,280,200,../Resources/Images/KikoDsm/HelpNoNetwork.png]

[ul][li]Press the standby button on your remote (top right)[/li][li]A playlist icon should appear on the display[/li][li]If a small 'x' appears as well (bottom right) you are not connected to the network[/li][/ul]


If you are not connected to the network, try the following:

[ul][li]Make sure the ethernet cable is connected to your Kiko DSM and to your router[/li][li]Make sure your internet router is switched on[/li][li]If you are using a network switch, make sure it is switched on as well[/li][/ul]
If you are connected to the network, try the following:

[ul][li]Make sure this application has not been blocked by your firewall[/li][li]Try temporarily disabling your firewall and restarting this application[/li][li]Try power cycling your device and see if it now appears in the list[/li][/ul]

Page.Name: KikoDsmNetworkHelp_IdDevice
Page.Text: The easiest way to identify your device is to switch all of your other Kiko DSM devices off first.\n\nIf you only have one Kiko DSM device powered on, only one device should appear in the list and you will know it is the right one.

Page.Name: KikoDsmNetworkHelp_RoomName
Page.Text: The room name helps to easily identify your device when using other Linn applications with your Kiko DSM. It is especially useful when you have more than one Linn device in your home.\n\nYou don't have to change the room name if you don't want to.

Page.Name: KikoDsm_Update
Page.Text: UPDATE
Load the latest software onto your device.
Update Box
Update Text
Update Progress Text

Default.Control: I don't have an internet connection

Page.Name: KikoDsmUpdateHelp_UpdateFailed
Page.Text:
No need to panic, the update process is safe, so you will always be able to recover your device.

[ul][li]Click Try Again to try the update again[/li][li]If this fails, power cycle your device and try again[/li][li]If this fails, put your device into fallback and try again. Push the fallback button using a pen, you should then see a fast flashing dot on the front display.[/li][/ul][HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/KikoDsm/HelpFallbackButton.png][HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/KikoDsm/HelpFallbackDisplay.png]
[ul][li]If your computer is connected to the network wirelessly, try connecting wired (using an ethernet cable) instead[/li][/ul]
If you are still having trouble with the update, there is most likely an issue with your network setup. You can contact Linn for more help.

Page.Name: KikoDsmUpdateHelp_UpdateCheckFailed
Page.Text:
An internet connection is required to update your Kiko DSM to the latest firmware.

If you are connected to the internet, try the following:

[ul][li]Make sure this application has not been blocked by your firewall[/li][li]Try temporarily disabling your firewall and restarting this application[/li][/ul]

Page.Name: KikoDsmUpdateHelp_NoUpdate
Page.Text: This means that your Kiko DSM already has the latest firmware. Just click to proceed to the next step.

Page.Name: KikoDsmUpdateHelp_NoInternet
Page.Text: An internet connection is required to update your Kiko DSM to the latest firmware. Click to proceed to the next step to skip the update.

Page.Name: KikoDsm_Stream
Page.Text: STREAM
Click the PLAY button to stream a sample track from this computer to your Kiko DSM.
Symphony No.35 in D major (Haffner), K.385 iv Finale Presto\nScottish Chamber Orchestra\nMozart Symphonies 29, 31 (Paris), 32, 35 (Haffner) & 36 (Linz)
Status
Volume

Page.Name: KikoDsmStreamHelp_NoAudio
Page.Text:
Once you press the play button the Kiko DSM should be playing the test track. Try the following:

[ul][li]Use the on screen volume controls to increase the volume[/li][li]If this fails, try increasing the volume using the remote[/li][HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpVolumeButtons.png][li]Make sure your speakers are still connected correctly[/li][/ul]
If the track is still not playing, try the following:

[ul][li]Make sure this application has not been blocked by your firewall[/li][li]Try temporarily disabling your firewall and restarting this application[/li][/ul]

Page.Name: KikoDsmStreamHelp_BadAudio
Page.Text:
There is most likely a latency issue with your network (audio is not being delivered fast enough).

[ul][li]If your computer is connected to the network wirelessly, try connecting wired (using an ethernet cable) instead[/li][li]If you are using homeplugs in your network, your network latency may be decreased[/li][/ul]
You can have a look at our {http://docs.linn.co.uk/wiki/index.php/DS_Budget_System, network setup guide} for more information.

Page.Name: KikoDsm_CustomiseSongcast1
Page.Text: SONGCAST & YOUR DS
Our Songcast software allows you to play any audio from your computer directly through your Linn system. Simply download Songcast, press play on your Mac or PC and listen through your Linn.
Use Songcast to play any computer audio through your Kiko DSM?

Page.Name: KikoDsm_CustomiseSources

Your Kiko DSM allows you to enjoy exceptional sound from your favorite sources including TV, Blu-ray, games consoles or audio players.
Would you like to connect any of these sources?

Page.Name: KikoDsm_CustomiseTv

If you plan to use your Kiko DSM to listen to the audio from HDMI video sources (e.g. a games console or Blu-ray player), connect the HDMI output of your Kiko DSM to an HDMI input on your TV.
Connect the HDMI cable to an input on your TV

Page.Name: KikoDsm_CustomiseSourceName
Page.Text: CONNECT A SOURCE
The following steps will guide you through connecting an external source product to your Kiko DSM. To get started, enter a name for the external source that you wish to connect.
Name the source to connect
For example: Blu-ray

Page.Name: KikoDsm_CustomiseSourceType
Page.Text: CHOOSE A CONNECTOR
Click on the connector that you will use to connect the external source to your Kiko DSM.

Page.Name: KikoDsm_CustomiseSourceInputHdmi
Page.Text: CONNECT
Connect the external source to an HDMI input socket on the back of your Kiko DSM. Select the input used by clicking its icon.

Page.Name: KikoDsm_CustomiseSourceInputSpdif
Page.Text: CONNECT
Connect the external source to the SPDIF input socket on the back of your Kiko DSM. Once the source is connected, click the icon to continue.

Page.Name: KikoDsm_CustomiseSourceInputToslink
Page.Text: CONNECT
Connect the external source to the TOSLINK input socket on the back of your Kiko DSM. Once the source is connected, click the icon to continue.

Page.Name: KikoDsm_CustomiseSourceInputAnalog
Page.Text: CONNECT

Page.Name: KikoDsm_CustomiseSourceIcon

The front panel of your Kiko DSM will display an icon when it is playing the audio from this external source. You can change this icon to any of those shown below.
Choose a different icon?

Page.Name: KikoDsm_CustomisePlaylist
Page.Text: GET AWAY FROM YOUR COMPUTER

Escape the computer and control all your music from anywhere in the home. Our Kinsky app allows you to create playlists, listen to podcasts or choose your favorite radio station all from the comfort of the couch.
Use Kinsky to control your music?

Default.Control: What is the Linn Songcast app
What sort of devices can I connect
I'm not sure how to connect my device
What are the source names for
What are the source icons for
Do I have to use a computer

Page.Name: KikoDsmCustomiseHelp_Songcast1
Page.Text: You can send any audio from your PC or Mac to your Kiko DSM. That means you can play your existing iTunes music collection or listen to streaming music services such as Spotify, Napster and Last FM, all through your Kiko DSM. If you're watching You Tube or a movie in Netflix, you can also send the audio to your DSM.\n\nIn order to do this you will need to download and install the Linn Songcast app. More details on this and instructions on where to download the app can be found in our {http://www.linn.co.uk/support/using-your-system/play-music-wirelessly, online support pages}.

Page.Name: KikoDsmCustomiseHelp_Sources
Page.Text: Your Kiko DSM can play the audio from external devices such as Games Consoles, Set-top Boxes, DVD players and Record Players. Simply follow the steps in this Wizard to connect a cable between your devices and the Kiko DSM. For more details, you can also go to our {http://www.linn.co.uk/support/using-your-system/connect-other-hardware-to-your-system, online support pages}.

Page.Name: KikoDsmCustomiseHelp_Tv
Page.Text:
There are two reasons for connecting your TV to your Kiko DSM.

The first is when you are connecting video devices such as games consoles or Blu-ray players to your Kiko DSM using an HDMI cable. In this case, the HDMI output from the device should be connected to one of the HDMI inputs on the Kiko DSM. Then, the HDMI output of the Kiko DSM should be connected to an HDMI input on your TV. This means that the Kiko DSM can take the HDMI data from the device, play the audio from the signal and then pass the video through to the TV.

The second reason for connecting your TV to your Kiko DSM is when you want to take the audio output from the TV. In this case, the TV is treated just like any other external source of audio. The audio output from the TV should be connected to one of the inputs on the back of the Kiko DSM - this Wizard will guide you through this process.

Page.Name: KikoDsmCustomiseHelp_HowToConnect
Page.Text:
You can connect external devices to your Kiko DSM using the following connections:

[ul][li]HDMI[/li][li]SPDIF[/li][li]TOSLINK[/li][li]Analogue (RCA connectors)[/li][/ul]
If you are connecting a video product, such as a games console or blu-ray player, for the best results we suggest you connect using HDMI if possible.

Page.Name: KikoDsmCustomiseHelp_SourceName
Page.Text: The source names help to easily identify what source to listen to when using other Linn applications with your Kiko DSM. It means you don't have to remember which connector your other devices use.\n\nYou don't have to change the source names if you don't want to.

Page.Name: KikoDsmCustomiseHelp_SourceIcon
Page.Text: The source icons help to easily identify what source to listen to when using your remote (the icon will appear on the front display). It means you don't have to remember which connector your other devices use.\n\nYou don't have to change the source icons if you don't want to.

Page.Name: KikoDsmCustomiseHelp_NoAudio
Page.Text: If you cannot hear any audio at this point you can perform the following checks:\n\n[ul][li]Check that the cable is connected to the Kiko DSM using the input shown in the summary page[/li][li]Check that the cable is connected to the correct output of the external device. You may need to consult the device manual for this[/li][li]Ensure that the external device is producing audio. If the device has its own volume control, ensure that it is set to what should be an audible level[/li][li]Use the on screen buttons to increase the volume of the Kiko DSM[/li][li]If this fails, try increasing the volume using the remote[/li][HelpImage,210,150,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpVolumeButtons.png][li]Make sure your speakers are still connected correctly[/li][li]Press the info button on the remote. The front panel display of the Kiko DSM should display the icon that you selected for this device. If this is not the case, use the back button to return to the page where you entered the name to be used for the device and then go through the Wizard steps once more.[/li][li]If you are still having problems, contact Linn customer support.[/li][/ul]

Page.Name: KikoDsmCustomiseHelp_NoComputer
Page.Text: You can get away from your computer and control your Kiko DSM using a tablet or smartphone. This involves installing the Kinsky app on your device to control your system and also installing Songbox to allow your music collection to be accessible on the network. More details on system setup and instructions on installing software can be found in our {http://www.linn.co.uk/support/using-your-system/get-away-from-the-computer, online support pages}

Page.Name: KlimaxDsmConnectHelp_SpeakerConnect
Page.Text:
If you are using Linn Aktive speakers, connect the balanced outputs directly to the speakers.

If you are using passive speakers, connect the balanced outputs to your amplifier, then connect your amplifier to your speakers.

If you aren't using the balanced outputs, connect the phono outputs instead as shown.
[HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/KlimaxDsm/HelpSpeakersPhono.png]

Connect to a spare Ethernet (or LAN) socket on your internet router.

Switch your Klimax DSM on.
Turning On: A flashing dot should appear on the front display for up to 30 seconds, followed by the Linn logo.

Please select your device:
DEVICES FOUND

Enter the name of the room where your Klimax DSM will be used.
Name your room
For example: Kitchen

I can't see my device in the list
How do I know it's my device
What is the room name for

Page.Name: KlimaxDsmNetworkHelp_NoRouter
Page.Text:
An internet router is only required to make use of the full range of network features (like playing stored digital music, internet radio, etc) the Klimax DSM has to offer.

You can still connect other equipment (games consoles, set top boxes, Blu-ray players, etc) to your Klimax DSM and listen to them without an internet router.

If you don't want to use your Klimax DSM on the network, then you are done!

Page.Name: KlimaxDsmNetworkHelp_NoSocket
Page.Text:
You will need to use a network switch as well.

[ul][li]Connect your Klimax DSM to a network switch[/li][li]Connect another device that is currently connected to your internet router to the network switch[/li][li]Connect your network switch to your internet router.[/li][/ul]
You can have a look at our {http://docs.linn.co.uk/wiki/index.php/DS_Budget_System, network setup guide} for more information.

Page.Name: KlimaxDsmNetworkHelp_NoDotFlashing
Page.Text: This suggests that the Klimax DSM is not powering up.\n\n[ul][li]Check the power cable is connected securely[/li][li]Check that your mains outlet is active/switched on[/li][li]Check the power switch is set to ON[/li][/ul]

Page.Name: KlimaxDsmNetworkHelp_DotFlashingForever
Page.Text:
Your Klimax DSM is having trouble connecting to your internet router.
[HelpImageRight,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpEthernetLights.png]
Check the lights on the ethernet socket of your Klimax DSM. The yellow/orange light should be solid and the green light should be blinking.

If not, you are not connected to your router.

[ul][li]Make sure the ethernet cable is connected to your Klimax DSM and to your router[/li][li]Make sure your internet router is switched on[/li][li]If you are using a network switch, make sure it is switched on as well[/li][/ul]
If the lights on the ethernet socket of your Klimax DSM are on, your router is most likely configured incorrectly:

[ul][li]Your router must have DHCP enabled. This is the only way your Klimax DSM can join the network. This is the default configuration for most routers.[/li][/ul]
You can have a look at our {http://docs.linn.co.uk/wiki/index.php/DS_Budget_System, network setup guide} for more information.

Page.Name: KlimaxDsmNetworkHelp_NoDevice
Page.Text:
There is a problem finding your Klimax DSM on the network.[HelpImageRight,280,200,../Resources/Images/KlimaxDsm/HelpNoNetwork.png]

[ul][li]Press the standby button on your remote (top right)[/li][li]A playlist icon should appear on the display[/li][li]If a small 'x' appears as well (bottom right) you are not connected to the network[/li][/ul]


If you are not connected to the network, try the following:

[ul][li]Make sure the ethernet cable is connected to your Klimax DSM and to your router[/li][li]Make sure your internet router is switched on[/li][li]If you are using a network switch, make sure it is switched on as well[/li][/ul]
If you are connected to the network, try the following:

[ul][li]Make sure this application has not been blocked by your firewall[/li][li]Try temporarily disabling your firewall and restarting this application[/li][li]Try power cycling your device and see if it now appears in the list[/li][/ul]

Page.Name: KlimaxDsmNetworkHelp_IdDevice
Page.Text: The easiest way to identify your device is to switch all of your other Klimax DSM devices off first.\n\nIf you only have one Klimax DSM device powered on, only one device should appear in the list and you will know it is the right one.

Page.Name: KlimaxDsmNetworkHelp_RoomName
Page.Text: The room name helps to easily identify your device when using other Linn applications with your Klimax DSM. It is especially useful when you have more than one Linn device in your home.\n\nYou don't have to change the room name if you don't want to.

Page.Name: KlimaxDsm_Update
Page.Text: UPDATE
Load the latest software onto your device.
Update Box
Update Text
Update Progress Text

Default.Control: I don't have an internet connection

Page.Name: KlimaxDsmUpdateHelp_UpdateFailed
Page.Text:
No need to panic, the update process is safe, so you will always be able to recover your device.

[ul][li]Click Try Again to try the update again[/li][li]If this fails, power cycle your device and try again[/li][li]If this fails, put your device into fallback and try again. Push the fallback button using a pen, you should then see a flashing lightning bolt on the front display.[/li][/ul][HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/KlimaxDsm/HelpFallbackButton.png][HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/KlimaxDsm/HelpFallbackDisplay.png]
[ul][li]If your computer is connected to the network wirelessly, try connecting wired (using an ethernet cable) instead[/li][/ul]
If you are still having trouble with the update, there is most likely an issue with your network setup. You can contact Linn for more help.

Page.Name: KlimaxDsmUpdateHelp_UpdateCheckFailed
Page.Text:
An internet connection is required to update your Klimax DSM to the latest firmware.

If you are connected to the internet, try the following:

[ul][li]Make sure this application has not been blocked by your firewall[/li][li]Try temporarily disabling your firewall and restarting this application[/li][/ul]

Page.Name: KlimaxDsmUpdateHelp_NoUpdate
Page.Text: This means that your Klimax DSM already has the latest firmware. Just click to proceed to the next step.

Page.Name: KlimaxDsmUpdateHelp_NoInternet
Page.Text: An internet connection is required to update your Klimax DSM to the latest firmware. Click to proceed to the next step to skip the update.

Page.Name: KlimaxDsm_Stream
Page.Text: STREAM
Click the PLAY button to stream a sample track from this computer to your Klimax DSM.
Symphony No.35 in D major (Haffner), K.385 iv Finale Presto\nScottish Chamber Orchestra\nMozart Symphonies 29, 31 (Paris), 32, 35 (Haffner) & 36 (Linz)
Status
Volume

Page.Name: KlimaxDsmStreamHelp_NoAudio
Page.Text:
Once you press the play button the Klimax DSM should be playing the test track. Try the following:

[ul][li]Use the on screen volume controls to increase the volume[/li][li]If this fails, try increasing the volume using the remote[/li][HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpVolumeButtons.png][li]Make sure your speakers are still connected correctly[/li][/ul]
If the track is still not playing, try the following:

[ul][li]Make sure this application has not been blocked by your firewall[/li][li]Try temporarily disabling your firewall and restarting this application[/li][/ul]

Page.Name: KlimaxDsmStreamHelp_BadAudio
Page.Text:
There is most likely a latency issue with your network (audio is not being delivered fast enough).

[ul][li]If your computer is connected to the network wirelessly, try connecting wired (using an ethernet cable) instead[/li][li]If you are using homeplugs in your network, your network latency may be decreased[/li][/ul]
You can have a look at our {http://docs.linn.co.uk/wiki/index.php/DS_Budget_System, network setup guide} for more information.

Page.Name: KlimaxDsm_CustomiseSongcast1
Page.Text: SONGCAST & YOUR DS
Our Songcast software allows you to play any audio from your computer directly through your Linn system. Simply download Songcast, press play on your Mac or PC and listen through your Linn.
Use Songcast to play any computer audio through your Klimax DSM?

Page.Name: KlimaxDsm_CustomiseSources
Page.Text: CONNECT YOUR LIVING ROOM
Your Klimax DSM allows you to enjoy exceptional sound from your favorite sources including TV, Blu-ray, games consoles or audio players.
Would you like to connect any of these sources?

Page.Name: KlimaxDsm_CustomiseTv
Page.Text: CONNECT YOUR TV
If you plan to use your Klimax DSM to listen to the audio from HDMI video sources (e.g. a games console or Blu-ray player), connect the HDMI output of your Klimax DSM to an HDMI input on your TV.
Connect the HDMI cable to an input on your TV

Page.Name: KlimaxDsm_CustomiseSourceName
Page.Text: CONNECT A SOURCE
The following steps will guide you through connecting an external source product to your Klimax DSM. To get started, enter a name for the external source that you wish to connect.
Name the source to connect
For example: Blu-ray

Page.Name: KlimaxDsm_CustomiseSourceType
Page.Text: CHOOSE A CONNECTOR
Click on the connector that you will use to connect the external source to your Klimax DSM.

Page.Name: KlimaxDsm_CustomiseSourceInputHdmi
Page.Text: CONNECT
Connect the external source to an HDMI input socket on the back of your Klimax DSM. Select the input used by clicking its icon.

Page.Name: KlimaxDsm_CustomiseSourceInputSpdif
Page.Text: CONNECT
Connect the external source to a SPDIF input socket on the back of your Klimax DSM. Select the input used by clicking its icon.

Page.Name: KlimaxDsm_CustomiseSourceInputToslink
Page.Text: CONNECT
Connect the external source to a TOSLINK input socket on the back of your Klimax DSM. Select the input used by clicking its icon.

Page.Name: KlimaxDsm_CustomiseSourceInputAnalog
Page.Text: CONNECT
Using the supplied input adapters, connect the external source to the left and right balanced input sockets on the back of your Klimax DSM. Once the source is connected, click the icon to continue.

Page.Name: KlimaxDsm_CustomiseSourceInputBalanced
Page.Text: CONNECT
Connect the external source to the left and right balanced input sockets on the back of your Klimax DSM. Once the source is connected, click the icon to continue.

Page.Name: KlimaxDsm_CustomiseSourceTest
Page.Text: TEST THE CONNECTION
This completes the set up for this source. On clicking the "Start Test" button, you should now hear the audio from the external source product through your Klimax DSM.
Do you want to connect another source?
Name
Connector

Page.Name: KlimaxDsm_CustomisePlaylist
Page.Text: GET AWAY FROM YOUR COMPUTER

Escape the computer and control all your music from anywhere in the home. Our Kinsky app allows you to create playlists, listen to podcasts or choose your favorite radio station all from the comfort of the couch.
Use Kinsky to control your music?

Default.Control: What is the Linn Songcast app
What sort of devices can I connect
I'm not sure how to connect my device
What are the source names for
Do I have to use a computer

Page.Name: KlimaxDsmCustomiseHelp_Songcast1
Page.Text: You can send any audio from your PC or Mac to your Klimax DSM. That means you can play your existing iTunes music collection or listen to streaming music services such as Spotify, Napster and Last FM, all through your Klimax DSM. If you're watching You Tube or a movie in Netflix, you can also send the audio to your DSM.\n\nIn order to do this you will need to download and install the Linn Songcast app. More details on this and instructions on where to download the app can be found in our {http://www.linn.co.uk/support/using-your-system/play-music-wirelessly, online support pages}.

Page.Name: KlimaxDsmCustomiseHelp_Sources
Page.Text: Your Klimax DSM can play the audio from external devices such as Games Consoles, Set-top Boxes, DVD players and Record Players. Simply follow the steps in this Wizard to connect a cable between your devices and the Klimax DSM. For more details, you can also go to our {http://www.linn.co.uk/support/using-your-system/connect-other-hardware-to-your-system, online support pages}.

Page.Name: KlimaxDsmCustomiseHelp_Tv
Page.Text:
There are two reasons for connecting your TV to your Klimax DSM.

The first is when you are connecting video devices such as games consoles or Blu-ray players to your Klimax DSM using an HDMI cable. In this case, the HDMI output from the device should be connected to one of the HDMI inputs on the Klimax DSM. Then, the HDMI output of the Klimax DSM should be connected to an HDMI input on your TV. This means that the Klimax DSM can take the HDMI data from the device, play the audio from the signal and then pass the video through to the TV.

The second reason for connecting your TV to your Klimax DSM is when you want to take the audio output from the TV. In this case, the TV is treated just like any other external source of audio. The audio output from the TV should be connected to one of the inputs on the back of the Klimax DSM - this Wizard will guide you through this process.

Page.Name: KlimaxDsmCustomiseHelp_HowToConnect
Page.Text:
You can connect external devices to your Klimax DSM using the following connections:

[ul][li]HDMI[/li][li]SPDIF[/li][li]TOSLINK[/li][li]Analogue (RCA connectors)[/li][li]Balanced Analogue (XLR connectors)[/li][/ul]
If you are connecting a video product, such as a games console or blu-ray player, for the best results we suggest you connect using HDMI if possible. If you are connecting a device using the Analogue RCA connectors, you will need to use the RCA to XLR adapters included with your Klimax DSM.

Page.Name: KlimaxDsmCustomiseHelp_SourceName
Page.Text: The source names help to easily identify what source to listen to when using other Linn applications with your Klimax DSM. It means you don't have to remember which connector your other devices use.

Page.Name: KlimaxDsmCustomiseHelp_NoAudio
Page.Text: If you cannot hear any audio at this point you can perform the following checks:\n\n[ul][li]Check that the cable is connected to the Klimax DSM using the input shown in the summary page[/li][li]Check that the cable is connected to the correct output of the external device. You may need to consult the device manual for this[/li][li]Ensure that the external device is producing audio. If the device has its own volume control, ensure that it is set to what should be an audible level[/li][li]Use the on screen buttons to increase the volume of the Klimax DSM[/li][li]If this fails, try increasing the volume using the remote[/li][HelpImage,210,150,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpVolumeButtons.png][li]Make sure your speakers are still connected correctly[/li][li]Pressing the info button on the remote will cause the front panel to cycle through various bits of information about the current source of the Klimax DSM. Eventually, the front panel should display the name that you entered for this device. If this is not the case, use the back button to return to the page where you entered the name and then go through the Wizard steps once more.[/li][li]If you are still having problems, contact Linn customer support.[/li][/ul]

Page.Name: KlimaxDsmCustomiseHelp_NoComputer
Page.Text: You can get away from your computer and control your Klimax DSM using a tablet or smartphone. This involves installing the Kinsky app on your device to control your system and also installing Songbox to allow your music collection to be accessible on the network. More details on system setup and instructions on installing software can be found in our {http://www.linn.co.uk/support/using-your-system/get-away-from-the-computer, online support pages}

Page.Name: AkurateDsm_Unpack1
Page.Text: UNPACK
This is everything that should be in your box.
Akurate DSM x1
Power cable x1
Audio cable x1
Batteries x2
Remote x1
You'll also need:

Page.Name: AkurateDsm_Unpack2
Page.Text: UNPACK
Fit the supplied batteries into your remote.
Plus (+) Side Up

Default.Control: I don't have an internet router
I can't fit the remote batteries

Page.Name: AkurateDsmUnpackHelp_NoRouter
Page.Text: An internet router is only required to make use of the full range of network features (like playing stored digital music, internet radio, etc) the Akurate DSM has to offer.\n\nYou can still connect other equipment (games consoles, set top boxes, Blu-ray players, etc) to your Akurate DSM and listen to them without an internet router.

Page.Name: AkurateDsmUnpackHelp_Missing
Page.Text: Sorry for the inconvenience. You will need to contact Linn to arrange a replacement.

Page.Name: AkurateDsmUnpackHelp_Batteries
Page.Text:
Removing the battery cover can be tricky. Try using a coin in the small insert at the top of the cover to help pop it off.

To remove (or replace) a battery, push down on it and slide it gently towards the right corner (marked with a small '+' on the remote). The battery should pop out on its own.
[HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpRemoteBatteries.png]
Batteries must be inserted into the remote plus (+) side up.

Page.Name: AkurateDsm_Connect1
Page.Text: CONNECT
Connect your speaker (or amplifier) cables to your Akurate DSM. You will also need to connect your speakers (and amplifier if used).

Page.Name: AkurateDsm_Connect2
Page.Text: CONNECT
Connect the supplied power cable.

Page.Name: AkurateDsm_Connect3
Page.Text: CONNECT
Switch your Akurate DSM on.
Turning On: A flashing dot should appear on the front display for up to 30 seconds, followed by the Linn logo.

Default.Control: I'm having trouble with the speaker cables
No dot is flashing when I switch on

Page.Name: AkurateDsmConnectHelp_SpeakerConnect
Page.Text:
If you are using Linn Aktive speakers, connect the balanced outputs directly to the speakers.

If you are using passive speakers, connect the balanced outputs to your amplifier, then connect your amplifier to your speakers.

If you aren't using the balanced outputs, connect the phono outputs instead as shown.
[HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/AkurateDsm/HelpSpeakersPhono.png]

Page.Name: AkurateDsmConnectHelp_NoDotFlashing
Page.Text: This suggests that the Akurate DSM is not powering up.\n\n[ul][li]Check the power cable is connected securely[/li][li]Check that your mains outlet is active/switched on[/li][li]Check the power switch is set to ON[/li]

Page.Name: AkurateDsmConnectHelp_DotFlashingForever
Page.Text:
This suggests that your Akurate DSM is attempting to connect to your home network.

At this stage, you should insure that the ethernet cable is NOT plugged in to the back of your Akurate DSM.
[HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpNoEthernetCable.png]

Page.Name: AkurateDsm_Audio1
Page.Text: AUDIO

Press and hold the # key on your remote for 3 seconds. The display should change from the Linn logo to Playlist as shown and audio should begin playing. You should hear both speakers together, followed by left then right separately.
Press and hold # to begin the audio check

Default.Control: I don't see a Linn Logo

Page.Name: AkurateDsmAudioHelp_NoLogo
Page.Text:
Your Akurate DSM must be in standby, indicated by the Linn logo, before you can proceed with the audio check.

Press the standby button on the remote. You should now see a Linn logo (as shown).
[HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpStandbyButton.png][HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/AkurateDsm/HelpLinnLogo.png]
If not, you will need to go back through the connection section and make sure everything is correctly connected and powered on.

Page.Name: AkurateDsmAudioHelp_NoDisplayChange
Page.Text:
Make sure you hold the # key down on the remote for at least 3 seconds.

If the display still does not change, you will need to make sure the remote is working correctly:

[ul][li]Press any button on the remote. You should see a red light come on behind the standby button.[/li][HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpRemoteLit.png][li]If the red light does not come on, you will need to check the remote batteries.[/li][li]Remember the remote batteries need to be inserted plus (+) side up.[/li][/ul]

Page.Name: AkurateDsmAudioHelp_NoDisplayX
Page.Text: The audio check will not run if your ethernet cable is connected. Please disconnect the ethernet cable and power cycle your device.\n[HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpNoEthernetCable.png]

Page.Name: AkurateDsmAudioHelp_Silence
Page.Text:
Try increasing the volume by pressing the Volume + button on the remote.[HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpVolumeButtons.png]
If this doesn't work, try the audio check again:

[ul][li]Put the device into standby using the standby button on the remote[/li][li]The Linn logo should now be shown on the dispaly. The audio check will not run if the device is not in standby.[/li][li]Trigger the audio check by pressing and holding the # key on the remote for at least 3 seconds[/li][li]Check that the display changes to show Playlist[/li][li]The display should also show a small 'x' in the bottom right corner.[/li][li]Try increasing the volume again[/li][/ul]

* Please Note: Davaar 7 firmware or higher is required for the audio check to function.

Page.Text: SONGCAST & YOUR DS
Our Songcast software allows you to play any audio from your computer directly through your Linn system. Simply download Songcast, press play on your Mac or PC and listen through your Linn.
Use Songcast to play any computer audio through your Akurate DSM?

Page.Name: AkurateDsm_CustomiseSources
Page.Text: CONNECT YOUR LIVING ROOM
Your Akurate DSM allows you to enjoy exceptional sound from your favorite sources including TV, Blu-ray, games consoles or audio players.
Would you like to connect any of these sources?

Page.Name: AkurateDsm_CustomiseTv
Page.Text: CONNECT YOUR TV
If you plan to use your Akurate DSM to listen to the audio from HDMI video sources (e.g. a games console or Blu-ray player), connect the HDMI output of your Akurate DSM to an HDMI input on your TV.
Connect the HDMI cable to an input on your TV

Page.Name: AkurateDsm_CustomiseSourceName
Page.Text: CONNECT A SOURCE
The following steps will guide you through connecting an external source product to your Akurate DSM. To get started, enter a name for the external source that you wish to connect.
Name the source to connect
For example: Blu-ray

Page.Name: AkurateDsm_CustomiseSourceType
Page.Text: CHOOSE A CONNECTOR
Click on the connector that you will use to connect the external source to your Akurate DSM.

Page.Name: AkurateDsm_CustomiseSourceInputHdmi
Page.Text: CONNECT
Connect the external source to an HDMI input socket on the back of your Akurate DSM. Select the input used by clicking its icon.

Page.Name: AkurateDsm_CustomiseSourceInputSpdif
Page.Text: CONNECT
Connect the external source to a SPDIF input socket on the back of your Akurate DSM. Select the input used by clicking its icon.

Page.Name: AkurateDsm_CustomiseSourceInputToslink
Page.Text: CONNECT
Connect the external source to a TOSLINK input socket on the back of your Akurate DSM. Select the input used by clicking its icon.

Page.Name: AkurateDsm_CustomiseSourceInputAnalog
Page.Text: CONNECT
Connect the external source to a pair of left and right analogue input sockets on the back of your Akurate DSM. Select the set of inputs used by clicking its icon.

Page.Name: AkurateDsm_CustomiseSourceInputBalanced
Page.Text: CONNECT
Connect the external source to the left and right balanced input sockets on the back of your Akurate DSM. Once the source is connected, click the icon to continue.

Page.Name: AkurateDsm_CustomiseSourceTest
Page.Text: TEST THE CONNECTION
This completes the set up for this source. On clicking the "Start Test" button, you should now hear the audio from the external source product through your Akurate DSM.
Do you want to connect another source?
Name
Connector

Page.Name: AkurateDsm_CustomisePlaylist
Page.Text: GET AWAY FROM YOUR COMPUTER

Escape the computer and control all your music from anywhere in the home. Our Kinsky app allows you to create playlists, listen to podcasts or choose your favorite radio station all from the comfort of the couch.
Use Kinsky to control your music?

Default.Control: What is the Linn Songcast app
What sort of devices can I connect
I'm not sure how to connect my device
What are the source names for
Do I have to use a computer

Page.Name: AkurateDsmCustomiseHelp_Songcast1
Page.Text: You can send any audio from your PC or Mac to your Akurate DSM. That means you can play your existing iTunes music collection or listen to streaming music services such as Spotify, Napster and Last FM, all through your Akurate DSM. If you're watching You Tube or a movie in Netflix, you can also send the audio to your DSM.\n\nIn order to do this you will need to download and install the Linn Songcast app. More details on this and instructions on where to download the app can be found in our {http://www.linn.co.uk/support/using-your-system/play-music-wirelessly, online support pages}.

Page.Name: AkurateDsmCustomiseHelp_Sources
Page.Text: Your Akurate DSM can play the audio from external devices such as Games Consoles, Set-top Boxes, DVD players and Record Players. Simply follow the steps in this Wizard to connect a cable between your devices and the Akurate DSM. For more details, you can also go to our {http://www.linn.co.uk/support/using-your-system/connect-other-hardware-to-your-system, online support pages}.

Page.Name: AkurateDsmCustomiseHelp_Tv
Page.Text:
There are two reasons for connecting your TV to your Akurate DSM.

The first is when you are connecting video devices such as games consoles or Blu-ray players to your Akurate DSM using an HDMI cable. In this case, the HDMI output from the device should be connected to one of the HDMI inputs on the Akurate DSM. Then, the HDMI output of the Akurate DSM should be connected to an HDMI input on your TV. This means that the Akurate DSM can take the HDMI data from the device, play the audio from the signal and then pass the video through to the TV.

The second reason for connecting your TV to your Akurate DSM is when you want to take the audio output from the TV. In this case, the TV is treated just like any other external source of audio. The audio output from the TV should be connected to one of the inputs on the back of the Akurate DSM - this Wizard will guide you through this process.

Page.Name: AkurateDsmCustomiseHelp_HowToConnect
Page.Text:
You can connect external devices to your Akurate DSM using the following connections:

[ul][li]HDMI[/li][li]SPDIF[/li][li]TOSLINK[/li][li]Analogue (RCA connectors)[/li][li]Balanced Analogue (XLR connectors)[/li][/ul]
If you are connecting a video product, such as a games console or blu-ray player, for the best results we suggest you connect using HDMI if possible.

Page.Name: AkurateDsmCustomiseHelp_SourceName
Page.Text: The source names help to easily identify what source to listen to when using other Linn applications with your Akurate DSM. It means you don't have to remember which connector your other devices use.

Page.Name: AkurateDsmCustomiseHelp_NoAudio
Page.Text: If you cannot hear any audio at this point you can perform the following checks:\n\n[ul][li]Check that the cable is connected to the Akurate DSM using the input shown in the summary page[/li][li]Check that the cable is connected to the correct output of the external device. You may need to consult the device manual for this[/li][li]Ensure that the external device is producing audio. If the device has its own volume control, ensure that it is set to what should be an audible level[/li][li]Use the on screen buttons to increase the volume of the Akurate DSM[/li][li]If this fails, try increasing the volume using the remote[/li][HelpImage,210,150,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpVolumeButtons.png][li]Make sure your speakers are still connected correctly[/li][li]Pressing the info button on the remote will cause the front panel to cycle through various bits of information about the current source of the Akurate DSM. Eventually, the front panel should display the name that you entered for this device. If this is not the case, use the back button to return to the page where you entered the name and then go through the Wizard steps once more.[/li][li]If you are still having problems, contact Linn customer support.[/li][/ul]

Page.Name: AkurateDsmCustomiseHelp_NoComputer
Page.Text: You can get away from your computer and control your Akurate DSM using a tablet or smartphone. This involves installing the Kinsky app on your device to control your system and also installing Songbox to allow your music collection to be accessible on the network. More details on system setup and instructions on installing software can be found in our {http://www.linn.co.uk/support/using-your-system/get-away-from-the-computer, online support pages}

Page.Name: MajikDsm_Unpack1
Page.Text: UNPACK
This is everything that should be in your box.
Majik DSM x1
Power cable x1
Batteries x2
Remote x1
You'll also need:

Page.Name: MajikDsm_Unpack2
Page.Text: UNPACK
Fit the supplied batteries into your remote.
Plus (+) Side Up

Default.Control: I don't have an internet router
I can't fit the remote batteries

Page.Name: MajikDsmUnpackHelp_NoRouter
Page.Text: An internet router is only required to make use of the full range of network features (like playing stored digital music, internet radio, etc) the Majik DSM has to offer.\n\nYou can still connect other equipment (games consoles, set top boxes, Blu-ray players, etc) to your Majik DSM and listen to them without an internet router.

Page.Name: MajikDsmUnpackHelp_Missing
Page.Text: Sorry for the inconvenience. You will need to contact Linn to arrange a replacement.

Page.Name: MajikDsmUnpackHelp_Batteries
Page.Text:
Removing the battery cover can be tricky. Try using a coin in the small insert at the top of the cover to help pop it off.

To remove (or replace) a battery, push down on it and slide it gently towards the right corner (marked with a small '+' on the remote). The battery should pop out on its own.
[HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpRemoteBatteries.png]
Batteries must be inserted into the remote plus (+) side up.

Page.Name: MajikDsm_Connect1
Page.Text: CONNECT
Connect your speaker cables to your Majik DSM. You will also need to connect your speakers.
Connect both speakers

Page.Name: MajikDsm_Connect2
Page.Text: CONNECT
Connect the supplied power cable.

Page.Name: MajikDsm_Connect3
Page.Text: CONNECT
Switch your Majik DSM on.
Turning On: A flashing dot should appear on the front display for up to 30 seconds, followed by the Linn logo.

Default.Control: I'm having trouble with the speaker cables
No dot is flashing when I switch on

Page.Name: MajikDsmConnectHelp_SpeakerConnect
Page.Text: If your speaker cables use bare wire connectors:\n\n[ul][li]Unscrew the speaker connectors on the back of your Majik DSM[/li][li]Insert the bare wire into the small hole behind the speaker connector[/li][li]Screw the speaker connector back into place so the bare wire is held in place (do not over tighten)[/li][/ul]

Page.Name: MajikDsmConnectHelp_NoDotFlashing
Page.Text: This suggests that the Majik DSM is not powering up.\n\n[ul][li]Check the power cable is connected securely[/li][li]Check that your mains outlet is active/switched on[/li][li]Check the power switch is set to ON[/li]

Page.Name: MajikDsmConnectHelp_DotFlashingForever
Page.Text:
This suggests that your Majik DSM is attempting to connect to your home network.

At this stage, you should insure that the ethernet cable is NOT plugged in to the back of your Majik DSM.
[HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpNoEthernetCable.png]

Page.Name: MajikDsm_Audio1
Page.Text: AUDIO

Press and hold the # key on your remote for 3 seconds. The display should change from the Linn logo to Playlist as shown and audio should begin playing. You should hear both speakers together, followed by left then right separately.
Press and hold # to begin the audio check

Default.Control: I don't see a Linn Logo

Page.Name: MajikDsmAudioHelp_NoLogo
Page.Text:
Your Majik DSM must be in standby, indicated by the Linn logo, before you can proceed with the audio check.

Press the standby button on the remote. You should now see a Linn logo (as shown).
[HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpStandbyButton.png][HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/MajikDsm/HelpLinnLogo.png]
If not, you will need to go back through the connection section and make sure everything is correctly connected and powered on.

Page.Name: MajikDsmAudioHelp_NoDisplayChange
Page.Text:
Make sure you hold the # key down on the remote for at least 3 seconds.

If the display still does not change, you will need to make sure the remote is working correctly:

[ul][li]Press any button on the remote. You should see a red light come on behind the standby button.[/li][HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpRemoteLit.png][li]If the red light does not come on, you will need to check the remote batteries.[/li][li]Remember the remote batteries need to be inserted plus (+) side up.[/li][/ul]

Page.Name: MajikDsmAudioHelp_NoDisplayX
Page.Text: The audio check will not run if your ethernet cable is connected. Please disconnect the ethernet cable and power cycle your device.\n[HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpNoEthernetCable.png]

Page.Name: MajikDsmAudioHelp_Silence
Page.Text:
Try increasing the volume by pressing the Volume + button on the remote.[HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpVolumeButtons.png]
If this doesn't work, try the audio check again:

[ul][li]Put the device into standby using the standby button on the remote[/li][li]The Linn logo should now be shown on the dispaly. The audio check will not run if the device is not in standby.[/li][li]Trigger the audio check by pressing and holding the # key on the remote for at least 3 seconds[/li][li]Check that the display changes to show Playlist[/li][li]The display should also show a small 'x' in the bottom right corner.[/li][li]Try increasing the volume again[/li][/ul]

* Please Note: Davaar 7 firmware or higher is required for the audio check to function.

Page.Name: MajikDsm_Network1
Page.Text: NETWORK
Switch your Majik DSM off.

Page.Name: MajikDsm_Network2
Page.Text: NETWORK
Connect your Majik DSM to your internet router using the supplied ethernet cable.
Connect to a spare Ethernet (or LAN) socket on your internet router.

Page.Name: MajikDsm_Network3
Page.Text: NETWORK
Switch your Majik DSM on.
Turning On: A flashing dot should appear on the front display for up to 30 seconds, followed by the Linn logo.

Page.Name: MajikDsm_Network4
Page.Text: NETWORK
Please select your device:
DEVICES FOUND

Page.Name: MajikDsm_Network5
Page.Text: NETWORK
Enter the name of the room where your Majik DSM will be used.
Name your room
For example: Kitchen

Default.Control: I don't have an internet router
My router doesn't have a spare socket
No dot is flashing when I switch on
I can't see my device in the list
How do I know it's my device
What is the room name for

Page.Name: MajikDsmNetworkHelp_NoRouter
Page.Text:
An internet router is only required to make use of the full range of network features (like playing stored digital music, internet radio, etc) the Majik DSM has to offer.

You can still connect other equipment (games consoles, set top boxes, Blu-ray players, etc) to your Majik DSM and listen to them without an internet router.

If you don't want to use your Majik DSM on the network, then you are done!

Page.Name: MajikDsmNetworkHelp_NoSocket
Page.Text:
You will need to use a network switch as well.

[ul][li]Connect your Majik DSM to a network switch[/li][li]Connect another device that is currently connected to your internet router to the network switch[/li][li]Connect your network switch to your internet router.[/li][/ul]
You can have a look at our {http://docs.linn.co.uk/wiki/index.php/DS_Budget_System, network setup guide} for more information.

Page.Name: MajikDsmNetworkHelp_NoDotFlashing
Page.Text: This suggests that the Majik DSM is not powering up.\n\n[ul][li]Check the power cable is connected securely[/li][li]Check that your mains outlet is active/switched on[/li][li]Check the power switch is set to ON[/li][/ul]

Page.Name: MajikDsmNetworkHelp_DotFlashingForever
Page.Text:
Your Majik DSM is having trouble connecting to your internet router.
[HelpImageRight,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpEthernetLights.png]
Check the lights on the ethernet socket of your Majik DSM. The yellow/orange light should be solid and the green light should be blinking.

If not, you are not connected to your router.

[ul][li]Make sure the ethernet cable is connected to your Majik DSM and to your router[/li][li]Make sure your internet router is switched on[/li][li]If you are using a network switch, make sure it is switched on as well[/li][/ul]
If the lights on the ethernet socket of your Majik DSM are on, your router is most likely configured incorrectly:

[ul][li]Your router must have DHCP enabled. This is the only way your Majik DSM can join the network. This is the default configuration for most routers.[/li][/ul]
You can have a look at our {http://docs.linn.co.uk/wiki/index.php/DS_Budget_System, network setup guide} for more information.

Page.Name: MajikDsmNetworkHelp_NoDevice
Page.Text:
There is a problem finding your Majik DSM on the network.[HelpImageRight,280,200,../Resources/Images/MajikDsm/HelpNoNetwork.png]

[ul][li]Press the standby button on your remote (top right)[/li][li]A playlist icon should appear on the display[/li][li]If a small 'x' appears as well (bottom right) you are not connected to the network[/li][/ul]


If you are not connected to the network, try the following:

[ul][li]Make sure the ethernet cable is connected to your Majik DSM and to your router[/li][li]Make sure your internet router is switched on[/li][li]If you are using a network switch, make sure it is switched on as well[/li][/ul]
If you are connected to the network, try the following:

[ul][li]Make sure this application has not been blocked by your firewall[/li][li]Try temporarily disabling your firewall and restarting this application[/li][li]Try power cycling your device and see if it now appears in the list[/li][/ul]

Page.Name: MajikDsmNetworkHelp_IdDevice
Page.Text: The easiest way to identify your device is to switch all of your other Majik DSM devices off first.\n\nIf you only have one Majik DSM device powered on, only one device should appear in the list and you will know it is the right one.

Page.Name: MajikDsmNetworkHelp_RoomName
Page.Text: The room name helps to easily identify your device when using other Linn applications with your Majik DSM. It is especially useful when you have more than one Linn device in your home.\n\nYou don't have to change the room name if you don't want to.

Page.Name: MajikDsm_Update
Page.Text: UPDATE
Load the latest software onto your device.
Update Box
Update Text
Update Progress Text

Default.Control: I don't have an internet connection

Page.Name: MajikDsmUpdateHelp_UpdateFailed
Page.Text:
No need to panic, the update process is safe, so you will always be able to recover your device.

[ul][li]Click Try Again to try the update again[/li][li]If this fails, power cycle your device and try again[/li][li]If this fails, put your device into fallback and try again. Push the fallback button using a pen, you should then see a flashing lightning bolt on the front display.[/li][/ul][HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/MajikDsm/HelpFallbackButton.png][HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/MajikDsm/HelpFallbackDisplay.png]
[ul][li]If your computer is connected to the network wirelessly, try connecting wired (using an ethernet cable) instead[/li][/ul]
If you are still having trouble with the update, there is most likely an issue with your network setup. You can contact Linn for more help.

Page.Name: MajikDsmUpdateHelp_UpdateCheckFailed
Page.Text:
An internet connection is required to update your Majik DSM to the latest firmware.

If you are connected to the internet, try the following:

[ul][li]Make sure this application has not been blocked by your firewall[/li][li]Try temporarily disabling your firewall and restarting this application[/li][/ul]

Page.Name: MajikDsmUpdateHelp_NoUpdate
Page.Text: This means that your Majik DSM already has the latest firmware. Just click to proceed to the next step.

Page.Name: MajikDsmUpdateHelp_NoInternet
Page.Text: An internet connection is required to update your Majik DSM to the latest firmware. Click to proceed to the next step to skip the update.

Page.Name: MajikDsm_Stream
Page.Text: STREAM
Click the PLAY button to stream a sample track from this computer to your Majik DSM.
Symphony No.35 in D major (Haffner), K.385 iv Finale Presto\nScottish Chamber Orchestra\nMozart Symphonies 29, 31 (Paris), 32, 35 (Haffner) & 36 (Linz)
Status
Volume

Page.Name: MajikDsmStreamHelp_NoAudio
Page.Text:
Once you press the play button the Majik DSM should be playing the test track. Try the following:

[ul][li]Use the on screen volume controls to increase the volume[/li][li]If this fails, try increasing the volume using the remote[/li][HelpImage,280,200,../Resources/Images/Accessories/HelpVolumeButtons.png][li]Make sure your speakers are still connected correctly[/li][/ul]
If the track is still not playing, try the following:

[ul][li]Make sure this application has not been blocked by your firewall[/li][li]Try temporarily disabling your firewall and restarting this application[/li][/ul]

Page.Name: MajikDsmStreamHelp_BadAudio
Page.Text:
There is most likely a latency issue with your network (audio is not being delivered fast enough).

[ul][li]If your computer is connected to the network wirelessly, try connecting wired (using an ethernet cable) instead[/li][li]If you are using homeplugs in your network, your network latency may be decreased[/li][/ul]
You can have a look at our {http://docs.linn.co.uk/wiki/index.php/DS_Budget_System, network setup guide} for more information.

Page.Name: AllDsm_Use
Page.Text: CONGRATULATIONS
You have finished the setup of your Linn DSM. Here is a summary of the features you have setup.
SONGCAST & YOUR DSM
CONNECT YOUR LIVING ROOM
GET AWAY FROM THE COMPUTER
In order to listen to online music and movies using your Linn system, you will need to download the Linn Songcast app for your Mac or PC.
Now that you have connected external sources to your Linn system, you can use your remote to switch between them.
To escape the computer, you will need to download the Linn Kinsky app for your phone or tablet.
You have chosen not to use Songcast to listen online music and movies.
You have not connected any external sources to your Linn System.
You have chosen not to control your music using Kinksy.
Find out more >
Find out more >
Find out more >
You're ready to go
That's it, your system is ready for anything. Visit our handy support site for hints, tips and guides on getting the most from your new system.
Find out more >
